Living Vengeance.name: Living Vengeance
Living Vengeance.blurb: On kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Speed. This bonus is larger if the enemy is a champion.
Living Vengeance.description: Innate: Varus gains 40% (+ 30% bonus attack speed)  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds upon an enemy champion  takedown, and 20% (+ 15% bonus attack speed) bonus attack speed on non-champion kills.

Piercing Arrow.name: Piercing Arrow
Piercing Arrow.blurb: Varus readies and then fires a powerful shot that gains extra range and damage the longer he spends preparing to fire.
Piercing Arrow.description: First Cast: Varus  charges for up to 4 seconds to gradually increase Piercing Arrow's  range and damage over the next 2 seconds, during which he is  pacified and  slowed by 20%.
Piercing Arrow.description2: Piercing Arrow is canceled when the charge ends, refunding  half of the mana cost.
Piercing Arrow.description3: Second Cast: Varus fires a piercing arrow dealing  physical damage to all enemies struck, which is increased by 0% − 50% (based on Channel time). The arrow's damage is reduced to 100% − 33% (based on enemy hit).
Piercing Arrow.leveling3:
Minimum Physical Damage:
10 / 46.67 / 83.33 / 120 / 156.67 (+ 110% AD)
Minimum Fully Reduced Damage:
3.3 / 15.4 / 27.5 / 39.6 / 51.7 (+ 36.3% AD)

Maximum Physical Damage:
15 / 70 / 125 / 180 / 235 (+ 165% AD)
Maximum Fully Reduced Damage:
4.95 / 23.1 / 41.25 / 59.4 / 77.55 (+ 54.45% AD)
Piercing Arrow.description4: Detonating  Blight stacks on an enemy champion reduces Piercing Arrow's  cooldown by 3 seconds.
Piercing Arrow.notes:
* Despite being  pacified, Varus can still  Flash (and cast all other summoner spells except  Teleport) during Piercing Arrow's channel.
 The range of the spell will always be displayed, even as it increases.
 Using  Recall while charging Piercing Arrow will also cancel the cast.

Blighted Quiver.name: Blighted Quiver
Blighted Quiver.blurb: Varus' basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and apply Blight. Varus' other abilities detonate Blight, dealing magic damage based on the target's maximum Health.
Blighted Quiver.description: Passive: Varus' basic attacks deal  bonus magic damage and apply Blight for 6 seconds, stacking up to 3 times.
Blighted Quiver.description2: Varus' other abilities detonate Blight on enemies upon damaging them, dealing magic damage for each stack. This damage is capped at 360 against monsters.
Blighted Quiver.leveling2:
Magic Damage per Stack:
3 / 3.5 / 4 / 4.5 / 5% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health
Maximum Magic Damage:
9 / 10.5 / 12 / 13.5 / 15% (+ 6% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health
Blighted Quiver.description3: Active: Varus' next  Piercing Arrow deals 6% − 14% (based on level) of the target's missing health bonus magic damage, increased by 0% − 50% (based on Piercing Arrow channel time), for a maximum of 9% − 21% (based on level) of the target's missing health. This damage is capped at 360 against monsters.
Blighted Quiver.description4: Blighted Quiver can be cast during the first 0.25 seconds of  Piercing Arrow. If the arrow is not fired within 5 seconds, Blighted Quiver is placed on a 1 second cooldown, or on full cooldown if the charge is canceled.
Blighted Quiver.notes:
*  Spell shield will not block the  on-hit damage but will block the consuming damage if the target is hit by his abilities.
 Blighted Quiver's active damage is dealt after the damage of  Piercing Arrow.

Hail of Arrows.name: Hail of Arrows
Hail of Arrows.blurb: Varus fires a hail of arrows that deal physical damage and desecrate the ground. Desecrated ground slows enemies' Movement Speed and reduces their self healing and regeneration.
Hail of Arrows.description: Active: Varus fires a hail of arrows that deals physical damage on impact to all enemies in the target area.
Hail of Arrows.description2: The area is desecrated for 4 seconds,  slowing all enemies standing in it and applying  Grievous Wounds.
Hail of Arrows.notes: * Slows will linger for 0.25 seconds after leaving the marked area.

Chain of Corruption.name: Chain of Corruption
Chain of Corruption.blurb: Varus flings out a damaging tendril of corruption that immobilizes the first enemy champion hit and then spreads towards nearby uninfected champions, immobilizing them too on contact.
Chain of Corruption.description: Active: Varus flings out a tendril of corruption that infects the first enemy champion hit, dealing magic damage and  rooting them for 2 seconds while inflicting them with full stacks of  Blight over 1.5 seconds.
Chain of Corruption.description2: On impact, the tendril seeks out nearby enemy champions for 2 seconds, after which they are also infected. Tendrils will continue to spread until there are no champions in range that have not already been affected.
Chain of Corruption.description3: Chain of Corruption will attempt to spread even if the first target dies or becomes free of the snare.
Chain of Corruption.notes:
* Enemy champions can be targeted again by the corruption if they were not affected the previous time, even if they were targeted and got out of range.
 Consuming the  Blight's stacks applied by Chain of Corruption will deal bonus magic damage based on  Blighted Quiver's rank. If  Blighted Quiver hasn't been ranked yet, the three  Blight's stacks will still be applied but they will be considered to be at rank 0, dealing 1.25% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health per stack.
